noun.description: The observation, description, and study of technologies and their application, especially within a particular social or historical context; an instance of this.

The use of information technology to focus and facilitate the running of a meeting, by having a person take notes which are immediately displayed for discussion by the participants. [A trademark in the United States.]

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Royal Statistical Society. From techno- + -graphy.
